back: express the probability of an intersection of events in terms of a sequence of conditional probabilities involving those events
A collection of sets $A_1, A_2, \ldots$ partitions the sample space $S$ if and only if \begin{align*} S &= \bigcup_i A_i, \mbox{ and } A_i \cap A_j = \emptyset, ~~~i \ne j. \end{align*}
Given an event $B \subseteq S$ and a partition of $S$ denoted by $A_1, A_2, \ldots$, \begin{align*} P(B) = \sum_i P(B|A_i)P(A_i).  \end{align*}
